intro: Ida rossyi, commonly known as the Ross's kauri, is a rare and ancient tree species native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Araucariaceae and is closely related to the kauri tree, sharing similar morphological features. The plant is characterized by its large, buttressed roots and can reach heights of up to 30 meters. Its leaves are spirally arranged and have a distinct, glossy appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Ida rossyi is considered a vulnerable species.
